hero.title: Your Personalized Mid-Level Frontend Engineer Roadmap is Ready!

radarAxes.label: Frontend
radarAxes.title: Frontend Mastery
radarAxes.description: Advanced React patterns, TypeScript, Next.js, and modern frontend frameworks.

radarAxes.label: UI/UX
radarAxes.title: UI/UX & Design
radarAxes.description: Design implementation, responsive layouts, CSS mastery, and design systems.

radarAxes.label: Performance
radarAxes.title: Performance & Optimization
radarAxes.description: Core Web Vitals (LCP, INP, CLS), lazy loading, code splitting, and optimization techniques.

radarAxes.label: Testing
radarAxes.title: Testing & Quality
radarAxes.description: Jest, React Testing Library, E2E testing, test coverage, and CI/CD pipelines.

radarAxes.label: Leadership
radarAxes.title: Architecture & Leadership
radarAxes.description: Component architecture, code reviews, mentoring, and technical decision-making.

easy: Strengthen your React fundamentals and component design
Practice building UI components from scratch
Polish your HTML/CSS skills for responsive layouts
doable: Build a solid DSA foundation - solve 50+ LeetCode problems
Master React hooks and state management basics
Create 2-3 frontend projects showcasing your skills
challenging: DSA practice is critical - aim for 100+ problems across patterns
Deep dive into React performance optimization
Build impressive portfolio projects with clean code
stretch: Plan for 6+ months of dedicated preparation
Master DSA and frontend fundamentals thoroughly
Consider gaining more hands-on experience first

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 2-3 frontend coding problems focusing on DOM manipulation and algorithms
Common topics: arrays, strings, basic recursion, and object manipulation
May include MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript fundamentals
Time management is key - aim to complete all problems

rounds.name: Machine Coding Round
points: Build a complete UI component from scratch (e.g., autocomplete, infinite scroll, image carousel)
Focus on clean code, component structure, and vanilla JS or React
Demonstrate responsive design and cross-browser compatibility
Working functionality matters more than pixel-perfect design

rounds.name: Technical Interview (DSA)
points: 1-2 easy-to-medium DSA problems with live coding
Focus on arrays, strings, hash maps, and basic tree traversal
Explain your approach and discuss time/space complexity
May include JavaScript-specific questions (closures, promises, event loop)

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Frontend)
points: Deep dive into React concepts: hooks, state management, component lifecycle
Questions on CSS (Flexbox, Grid, responsive design techniques)
Browser fundamentals: event bubbling, rendering process, performance
Build a small component live and explain your design choices

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Discussion about past projects and your role in them
Behavioral questions on teamwork, learning, and handling feedback
Why this company and role? Show genuine interest
Ask thoughtful questions about team structure and growth opportunities

easy: Keep practicing DSA regularly to stay sharp
Network and seek referrals to improve chances
doable: DSA fundamentals are essential - solve 75+ problems
Master React and modern frontend tooling
Prepare for machine coding rounds with timed practice
challenging: Strong DSA is mandatory - aim for 120+ problems
Deep understanding of React internals and optimization
Referrals significantly improve your chances - start networking
stretch: This requires 6-8 months of focused preparation
DSA mastery is non-negotiable at this level
Consider building more experience before targeting unicorns

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 3-4 coding problems ranging from easy to medium difficulty
Focus on JavaScript problem-solving and algorithmic thinking
May include frontend-specific challenges (DOM manipulation, async operations)
Passing score typically 60-70% to proceed to interviews

rounds.name: DSA Round 1
points: 1-2 medium problems on arrays, strings, or hash maps
Expected to arrive at optimal solution with hints
Code on shared editors like CoderPad or HackerRank
Interviewer evaluates problem-solving approach and communication

rounds.name: DSA Round 2 / Frontend Fundamentals
points: Could be another DSA round or deep dive into JavaScript internals
Topics: closures, prototypes, event loop, promises, this keyword
Questions on React: virtual DOM, reconciliation, hooks, performance
Write code to demonstrate concepts (e.g., implement Promise.all)

rounds.name: Machine Coding / UI Round
points: Build a real-world component: search with autocomplete, pagination, filters
Use React or vanilla JavaScript based on company preference
Focus on code organization, reusability, and edge case handling
Bonus points for responsive design and accessibility considerations

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Bar Raiser
points: Behavioral questions using STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Deep dive into your best project - technical decisions and trade-offs
Questions about handling challenges, tight deadlines, and collaboration
Culture fit assessment - research company values beforehand

easy: Focus on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals
Practice basic coding problems for aptitude tests
Prepare clear explanations of your projects
doable: Strengthen your core frontend skills - HTML, CSS, JS
Learn React basics and build simple applications
Practice common interview questions and coding basics
challenging: Solid understanding of web fundamentals is essential
Build a few portfolio projects to showcase
Focus on communication and explaining concepts clearly
stretch: Focus on fundamentals over advanced concepts
This should be very achievable with basic preparation

rounds.name: Aptitude & Online Test
points: Quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, and verbal ability
1-2 easy coding problems (basic loops, conditionals, arrays)
MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics
Focus on accuracy over speed - cutoff-based filtering

rounds.name: Technical Interview 1
points: Questions on HTML tags, CSS selectors, and JavaScript syntax
Explain concepts: var vs let vs const, event delegation, box model
Simple coding: reverse a string, find duplicates in array
Project discussion - be ready to explain your contributions clearly

rounds.name: Technical Interview 2
points: Deeper dive into JavaScript: closures, hoisting, callbacks
Basic React questions if it's on your resume: JSX, props, state
May ask to build a simple layout or debug existing code
Focus on fundamentals - breadth over depth

rounds.name: HR Interview
points: Standard questions: strengths, weaknesses, why this company
Career goals and willingness to learn new technologies
Salary expectations (be realistic for fresher roles)
Relocation flexibility and notice period discussion

easy: Maintain strong DSA practice - solve problems regularly
Prepare for frontend system design discussions
Practice behavioral interviews with STAR format
doable: DSA is the primary filter - solve 150+ LeetCode problems
Master React, performance optimization, and web fundamentals
Build impressive portfolio projects with production quality
challenging: DSA mastery is mandatory - aim for 200+ problems (medium/hard)
Deep frontend system design knowledge is expected
Strong referrals are almost essential - network actively
stretch: This is the highest bar - plan for 6+ months of intense prep
DSA at expert level is non-negotiable
Consider building 1-2 years of experience first

rounds.name: Recruiter Screen
points: Initial call to verify your background and interest
Overview of the interview process and timeline
Questions about visa status, location preferences, start date
Opportunity to ask about the team and role expectations

rounds.name: Phone/Online Technical Screen
points: 1-2 coding problems on shared editor (CoderPad, Google Docs)
Medium difficulty - arrays, strings, hash maps, or trees
Focus on clean code, edge cases, and optimal time complexity
Strong communication is essential - think out loud throughout

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 1
points: Medium to hard DSA problem with live whiteboard or code editor
Common topics: dynamic programming, trees, graphs, recursion
Interviewer evaluates problem breakdown and optimization
Expect follow-up questions to extend or modify your solution

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 2
points: Another DSA problem, potentially harder or different domain
May involve advanced data structures or complex logic
Write clean, bug-free code under time pressure
Discuss multiple approaches before settling on implementation

rounds.name: Onsite: Frontend System Design
points: Design a frontend system: autocomplete, infinite scroll, feed
Cover component architecture, state management, API design
Discuss performance: lazy loading, code splitting, caching
Address accessibility, error handling, and edge cases

rounds.name: Onsite: Behavioral / Googleyness
points: Amazon: Leadership Principles with STAR format
Google: Googleyness - collaboration, growth mindset, adaptability
Prepare stories about ownership, conflict, learning from failure
Questions like 'Tell me about a time you had to learn something new quickly'

rounds.name: Hiring Committee & Team Match
points: Google: Packet reviewed by hiring committee for final decision
Amazon: Bar raiser provides independent assessment
Team matching calls to find mutual fit
Process can take 2-4 weeks post-onsite

phases.title: Advanced React & TypeScript Mastery

whatYouLearn.title: TypeScript Advanced Patterns
whatYouLearn.description: Generic types, utility types, type guards, discriminated unions, and advanced TypeScript patterns for React

whatYouLearn.title: React Advanced Patterns
whatYouLearn.description: Compound components, render props, custom hooks, context optimization, suspense, and error boundaries

whatYouLearn.title: State Management at Scale
whatYouLearn.description: Redux Toolkit, Zustand, Jotai, React Query for server state, and choosing the right state management solution

phases.target: Build production-grade, type-safe React applications with advanced patterns
whyItMatters: TypeScript is becoming industry standard (used by 87% of top companies)
Advanced React patterns separate mid-level from senior developers
State management expertise is crucial for complex applications

phases.title: Performance Optimization & Accessibility

whatYouLearn.title: Core Web Vitals Optimization
whatYouLearn.description: Master LCP, INP, CLS metrics - image optimization, lazy loading, code splitting, and performance budgets

whatYouLearn.title: WCAG 2.1 Accessibility Compliance
whatYouLearn.description: Semantic HTML, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader testing, and accessibility auditing

whatYouLearn.title: Next.js & Server-Side Rendering
whatYouLearn.description: App Router, RSC, SSR vs SSG vs ISR, dynamic imports, and production optimization techniques

phases.target: Build fast, accessible applications that score 95+ on Lighthouse
whyItMatters: 97.4% of websites have WCAG failures - accessibility is a differentiator
Core Web Vitals directly impact SEO rankings and user retention
Next.js is the #1 React framework with 67% adoption in 2024

phases.title: Testing Strategies & DevOps

whatYouLearn.title: Comprehensive Testing Strategy
whatYouLearn.description: Jest unit tests, React Testing Library, Playwright/Cypress E2E testing, achieving 80%+ code coverage

whatYouLearn.title: CI/CD for Frontend
whatYouLearn.description: GitHub Actions, automated testing pipelines, deployment strategies, preview environments, and semantic versioning

whatYouLearn.title: Monitoring & Error Tracking
whatYouLearn.description: Sentry integration, performance monitoring, error boundaries, user analytics, and production debugging

phases.target: Implement automated testing and deployment pipelines for production applications
whyItMatters: Testing expertise is the #1 skill differentiator for mid-level roles
CI/CD knowledge shows production readiness and DevOps understanding
Top companies require 80%+ test coverage for frontend code

phases.title: Frontend Architecture & Leadership

whatYouLearn.title: Component Architecture & Design Systems
whatYouLearn.description: Building scalable component libraries, atomic design, design tokens, and documenting component APIs with Storybook

whatYouLearn.title: Frontend System Design
whatYouLearn.description: Architecture patterns, micro-frontends, module federation, scaling frontend applications, and technical trade-offs

whatYouLearn.title: Technical Leadership Skills
whatYouLearn.description: Code reviews, mentoring junior developers, technical documentation, architectural decision records (ADRs)

phases.target: Lead frontend architecture decisions and mentor other developers
whyItMatters: Architecture skills are required for senior-level promotions
Design systems reduce development time by 47% in large teams
Leadership abilities unlock tech lead and staff engineer roles

projects.title: Production-Grade Component Library & Design System
projects.description: Build a reusable component library with TypeScript, Storybook documentation, comprehensive testing, and npm publishing
projects.shortDescription: Component library with TypeScript, Storybook, and testing
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-ready component library featuring 15+ reusable components (Button, Input, Modal, Dropdown, etc.) built with React and TypeScript. Implement a design token system, comprehensive unit and integration tests, Storybook documentation, and publish to npm. This project demonstrates architecture skills, testing expertise, and ability to build scalable design systems used in real-world applications.

implementationSteps.title: Initialize Library Infrastructure
implementationSteps.description: Set up a monorepo structure using Vite for library bundling. Configure TypeScript with strict mode, path aliases, and declaration file generation. Initialize Storybook 7.x for component documentation. Set up dual package export (ESM + CJS) in package.json. Create a design tokens file with colors, spacing, typography scales using CSS variables and TypeScript.

implementationSteps.title: Build Core Component Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Create 15+ reusable components with TypeScript: Button (variants, sizes, loading states), Input, Select, Modal, Dropdown, Tooltip, Card, Badge, Alert, Tabs, Accordion, Checkbox, Radio, Switch, Avatar. Use compound component patterns for complex components. Implement polymorphic component types ('as' prop) and forwarded refs. Follow atomic design principles.

implementationSteps.title: Comprehensive Testing Strategy
implementationSteps.description: Write unit tests for each component using Jest and React Testing Library. Test user interactions, accessibility, edge cases, and prop combinations. Achieve 80%+ code coverage. Add visual regression testing with Chromatic or Percy. Set up test-driven development (TDD) workflow. Include snapshot tests for stable components.

implementationSteps.title: Storybook Documentation & Design Tokens
implementationSteps.description: Write comprehensive Storybook stories for all components with multiple variants, states, and use cases. Use Storybook Controls addon for interactive props. Document component APIs with JSDoc comments. Create a design tokens showcase page. Add Accessibility addon for a11y testing. Configure Storybook composition for multi-project docs.

implementationSteps.title: Build, Bundle & Publish to npm
implementationSteps.description: Configure Rollup or Vite to bundle the library with tree-shaking support. Generate TypeScript declaration files (.d.ts). Optimize bundle size with external peer dependencies (React, ReactDOM). Set up GitHub Actions CI/CD for automated testing and publishing. Publish to npm with semantic versioning. Create comprehensive README with installation, usage examples, and contribution guidelines. Add live Storybook deployment to Chromatic or Vercel.

projects.title: Real-Time Collaborative App with Next.js & WebSockets
projects.description: Build a real-time collaborative whiteboard/document editor with Next.js 14, WebSockets, optimistic UI updates, and conflict resolution
projects.shortDescription: Real-time collaboration app with Next.js and WebSockets
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade real-time collaborative application (whiteboard or document editor) using Next.js 14 App Router, WebSocket connections, and operational transformation for conflict resolution. Implement features like presence awareness, cursor tracking, undo/redo, and optimistic UI updates. This project demonstrates advanced state management, real-time systems, performance optimization, and building complex interactive applications.

implementationSteps.title: Next.js Setup & WebSocket Server
implementationSteps.description: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router and TypeScript. Set up WebSocket server using Socket.io or native WebSockets with a custom API route handler. Implement room-based connections where users join specific document/board sessions. Configure CORS and authentication middleware. Set up database (PostgreSQL/MongoDB) for persisting documents and user sessions.

implementationSteps.title: Build Collaboration Canvas/Editor
implementationSteps.description: Create the main canvas component using HTML5 Canvas API (for whiteboard) or a rich text editor library like Slate/Lexical (for documents). Implement drawing tools: pen, shapes, text, eraser for whiteboard OR formatting toolbar for document editor. Use React hooks for managing canvas state and rendering. Optimize rendering with requestAnimationFrame and debouncing.

implementationSteps.title: Real-Time Synchronization & Conflict Resolution
implementationSteps.description: Implement operational transformation (OT) or CRDTs (like Yjs) for conflict-free collaborative editing. Broadcast user actions (draw, edit, delete) via WebSocket to all connected clients. Implement optimistic UI updates: apply changes immediately locally, then sync with server. Handle network failures with retry logic and offline queueing. Use vector clocks or timestamps for ordering operations.

implementationSteps.title: Presence Awareness & User Experience
implementationSteps.description: Build presence system showing active users with avatars and colored cursors. Implement real-time cursor tracking that broadcasts mouse positions. Add user selection highlights for documents or active drawing areas. Create undo/redo functionality with operation history. Implement auto-save with debouncing every 2-3 seconds. Show connection status indicators and reconnection logic.

implementationSteps.title: Performance Optimization & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Optimize bundle size with dynamic imports and code splitting. Implement virtualization for large documents using react-window. Add Redis caching for frequently accessed documents. Set up Playwright E2E tests for collaboration scenarios. Configure Vercel deployment with WebSocket support or use separate WebSocket server on Railway/Fly.io. Add comprehensive error handling, logging with Sentry, and analytics. Document architecture with sequence diagrams.

projects.title: Performance-Optimized Analytics Dashboard
projects.description: Build a high-performance analytics dashboard with 95+ Lighthouse score, virtualization, lazy loading, and comprehensive accessibility
projects.shortDescription: Optimized dashboard with accessibility and 95+ Lighthouse score
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade analytics dashboard that handles large datasets efficiently while maintaining 95+ Lighthouse performance score. Implement data virtualization for rendering 10,000+ rows, lazy loading for charts, code splitting, and comprehensive WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility. This project demonstrates performance optimization expertise, accessibility implementation, and ability to build scalable data-intensive applications.
learnings: Core Web Vitals Optimization (LCP, INP, CLS)
skillsYouLearn: Core Web Vitals Optimization (LCP, INP, CLS)

implementationSteps.title: Architecture & Performance Setup
implementationSteps.description: Initialize Next.js 14 with App Router and TypeScript. Set up bundle analyzer (next-bundle-analyzer) and Lighthouse CI. Create mock API with 10,000+ rows of analytics data (users, sales, metrics). Configure dynamic imports for all heavy components. Set up performance monitoring with Web Vitals reporting. Establish performance budgets: LCP < 2.5s, INP < 200ms, CLS < 0.1.

implementationSteps.title: Data Virtualization & Large Lists
implementationSteps.description: Implement virtual scrolling using react-window or react-virtualized for data tables rendering 10,000+ rows. Only render visible items plus buffer. Add windowed infinite scroll with React Query for pagination. Optimize table re-renders with React.memo and useMemo. Implement column sorting and filtering without blocking UI. Use Web Workers for heavy data processing like aggregations and transformations.

implementationSteps.title: Code Splitting & Lazy Loading
implementationSteps.description: Dynamically import chart libraries (Recharts/Chart.js) with React.lazy and Suspense. Implement route-based code splitting for each dashboard section. Use next/dynamic for heavy components with SSR disabled where appropriate. Optimize images with next/image, srcset, and WebP format. Lazy load below-the-fold content with Intersection Observer. Implement prefetching for likely navigation paths.

implementationSteps.title: WCAG 2.1 Level AA Accessibility
implementationSteps.description: Ensure all interactive elements are keyboard navigable (Tab, Enter, Arrow keys). Add proper ARIA labels, roles, and live regions for dynamic content updates. Implement skip navigation links and landmark regions. Use semantic HTML (nav, main, aside, article). Ensure 4.5:1 color contrast ratio for all text. Add screen reader announcements for chart data. Test with NVDA/JAWS and axe DevTools. Create focus management for modals and dialogs.

implementationSteps.title: Performance Monitoring & Optimization
implementationSteps.description: Measure and optimize Core Web Vitals to achieve 95+ Lighthouse score. Use React Profiler to identify slow components. Implement request deduplication and caching with React Query. Add error boundaries for graceful error handling. Set up Sentry for error tracking and performance monitoring. Create custom performance metrics dashboard. Add Playwright tests with performance assertions. Deploy to Vercel with edge caching and document optimization strategies in README.
